item.title: A Quiet Place The Road Ahead: All Toy Collectibles Locations (Completionist Trophy)
item.description:
While quietly sneaking through the various locations in A Quiet Place The Road Ahead , players can stumble on the toy collectibles (space shuttles) to pick up. These collectibles can be found in air ducts, hidden away in debris, inside locked briefcases, or just out in the open.

The usual urge to get out of an area as soon as possible is justified, but collecting toys along the way will net you the Completionist trophy, as well as in-game credits. Players will be able to use these credits to unlock bonus content in the Extra menu, which includes concept art and 3D character models.

Location for All Toy Collectibles in A Quiet Place The Road Ahead

There are a total of 35 space shuttle toy collectibles hidden away in different chapters/locations of A Quiet Place The Road Ahead. The amount of credit you get per toy depends on its color/rarity, i.e. gold (50 CR), silver (30 CR), and bronze (20 CR). Here's a list of all the locations of toy collectibles in the game.

Area

Rarity

Location

The Ranch

Bronze

In the opening area under the broken wooden structure.

Silver

Inside the kitchen area, it's accessible from a window in the back of the house.

Bronze

When first entering the air ducts, head left instead of right to find the toy.

The Hospital

Bronze

Inside a drawer in room 111.

Bronze

On a table inside the room where you get the key.

Silver

Next to a red car and a bucket in the parking lot section.

The Forest

Bronze

Under a tree that's next to the board with children drawing.

Gold

Cross the train tracks and climb over boxes to find the space shuttle on the right side of the train carriage.

Silver

While going downhill from the area where the monster is patrolling, climb up the ledge and find the toy.

Lake House

Silver

After talking to Martin and entering the house, look on the bookshelf to your right.

Gold

After following Martin upstairs, go to the room on the right and look inside the side table next to the bed.

Bronze

After climbing into the attic, find the toy on the table.

The Campsite

Bronze

At the start of the location, find the toy right beside the caravan.

Silver

On a bench after you pass the area with several noise traps and the monster is patrolling.

Bronze

On a crate right after the area where you turn on the radio in the watchtower.

Silver

Right after you pass under the house, climb over the barrier, go right, past the bear trap, and find the toy on a bench.

Trainwreck

Silver

After going into the second cave, look for two boxes blocking a tunnel. Move them away and head into the tunnel to find the toy.

Bronze

In the area where you unlock the second briefcase, grab the plank and place it down to the right to cross the hut and find the toy laying in the grass.

Gold

After crossing the open area with the creature patrolling, onto the train carriage and drop to the bridge's metal beams. Now keep moving forward until you find the toy on said beam.

Bronze

After finally making it through the trains and reaching the bottom of the bridge, make your way through the area with the creature patrolling. Move alongside the river and take a right. Follow the train to the right until you find the toy at the end.

Pump Station

Silver

After turning the valves to block steam, go up the stairs and descend the ladder on the right. Go through the offices into the hallway and make your way to the chain-linked fence. After crossing the fence, pick up the toy on the right over the table.

Silver

Inside the air ducts after passing through the office.

Gold

Behind the pipes inside the flood area with the containers.

The Harbor

Bronze

Right after passing through the tech store and climbing into the petrol station office, find the toy on a table in the blocked-off hallway to the right.

Gold

Right after opening the last briefcase, go back and pass the metal gate to find the toy on the right.

Silver

After climbing down from the roof onto the street level, find the toy right beside the ambulance.

Bronze

On a table inside the shack on the pier. You access said shack by picking up the plank, using it to reach the other side, picking the plank back up, and using it to access the shack at the far right end of the area.

Silver

In the upper section of the warehouse, which is accessible by placing a plank. You enter said warehouse after lifting the small boat that was blocking the path.

Bronze

After the previous toy, head back down and crouch to pass through the opening in the wall. After that, go up the stairs, climb out of the window, and look to your immediate left.

The Fire Station

Bronze

Right next to the Fire Station entrance after passing under the boxes and climbing on the platform.

Silver

After using the fuse box to open the door and grab the wooden plank, use it to cross over to the other side and go through the red door with the green light. Inside the room, change the fuse position from right to left to open the door inside and grab the toy on the table.

Silver

At the end of the hall, after you exit the control room with the sprinkler warning sign.

Bronze

Right from the previous toy's location, turn back and enter the room at the start of the hallway to the right. Make your way down the stairs, enter the vent, follow it until you drop into a room, and climb the vent on the right to find the toy.

Gold

After draining the water using the valve a second time, climb down to the lower platform and pick up the toy on the brown barrel.

Gold

Right after interacting with Laura and getting the gas mask, you'll find the last toy after getting on the other side of the chain-linked fence.

These were all the locations of toy collectibles found in A Quiet Place The Road Ahead . While finding the toy collectibles, you'll be unlocking the following trophies.

  • Distracted Child : After your first collectible.
  • Collector : After gathering 10 toy collectibles.
  • Completionist : After gathering all the toy collectibles.

After you've collected all of them, head over to the Extra menu on the title screen and purchase artwork or 3D models of characters you like. Do note that while unlocking bonus content in the Extra menu, you'll unlock the following trophies in A Quiet Place The Road Ahead .

  • Art Lover : After unlocking your first concept art.
  • Art Critic : After unlocking all the concept arts.
  • Passionate : After unlocking your first 3D Model.
  • Patron : After unlocking all the 3D Models.

item.title: Fear the Spotlight: How to Unlock the Rose Door
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Rose Door Puzzle Solution in Fear the Spotlight
    • How to Find the Toolbox
    • How to Fix the Broken Pliers
    • How to Escape the Spotlight Head Without Getting Spotted
    • How to Get the Metal Rose

Fear the Spotlight is filled with exciting puzzles, and one of the first puzzles that players encounter in the game involves unlocking a door with a golden statue. Walking up close and inspecting the door reveals that the statue has its hands outstretched. Seasoned horror players will immediately be able to tell that they'll need to find something for the hand in order to open the door.

Solving the puzzle and opening the door are essential to progression. There’s also an achievement/trophy tied to it called Thorned Key. Once you manage to open the door, you’ll automatically unlock this achievement. Here's how to solve the Rose Door puzzle in Fear the Spotlight and unlock this achievement.

Rose Door Puzzle Solution in Fear the Spotlight

After running away from the library fire in the first section of Fear the Spotlight , you’ll find yourself in the School Hallway. Keep moving forward, and a door will open at the end of the hall. Here, you’ll see a door with a Golden Statue on it. This is the Rose Door. Interact with it and inspect the outstretched hand to update your To-Do List.

To open the Rose Door, you’ll have to find some key items, mainly the Screwdriver and the Pliers , which will help you collect the Metal Rose from the Locker Room .

How to Find the Toolbox

After interacting with the Rose Door, head down the right hallway and take the door you see on your right. You’ll arrive at the Locker Room. Check the window on your left, and you’ll notice the toolbox sitting on a table. You won't be able to open the door to the Office just yet; you’ll need to get the Office Keycard first.

You’ll see an Elusive Specter when you run down the hallway from the Rose Door, but don’t worry; they’re harmless.

Check the area thoroughly and read all the notes. On the left side of the locker room, you’ll see a patch of dirt and a golden Metal Rose popping out of it. Interact with the patch of dirt, dig the dirt, and you’ll see that the Rose is held by a set of hands. You’ll also see a vending machine in the room and a box of Welding Glue inside it at the B34 slot.

Go into the washroom on the left side and inspect the Gym Bag sitting on the table. Open the Zipper to collect the Office Keycard . Additionally, grab the Inhaler behind you near the trash bin.

Use the Office Keycard to get into the office and interact with the Toolbox. It has a combination lock, and you’ll find the password in a note near the lockers in the Office. The password is 001 , and it can be used to open the Toolbox and grab the Screwdriver inside. You won't be able to take the Pliers, since they’re broken and need to be fixed before you can use them.

You’ll get an achievement if you unlock the Toolbox without reading the Note with the password.

How to Fix the Broken Pliers

To fix the Broken Pliers, you’ll need the Welding Glue you saw inside the Vending Machine earlier. However, you’ll have to find some quarters first. Open the vent inside the Office using the Screwdriver and crouch through the opening. Go to the other side of the rubble and interact with the window to get into the Boy’s Locker Room .

The entrance to the washroom is blocked, but you’ll find an opening in the wall that you can crouch through. Go inside and interact with the grate on the floor. Here, use the Screwdriver to remove the screws , and you’ll find Two Quarters inside. Pick them up.

Now, you’ll have to get back to the Vending Machine, but you’ll have your first encounter with a Spotlight Head in the Boy’s Locker Room as soon as you crouch back out through the hole. It’s a humanoid monster that has a spotlight for a head. There’s no way to kill it, so you’ll have to stealthily walk back to the window. Stepping into the light will have you pulled towards it, causing damage. Thankfully, there is plenty of cover in the area, and even if you get caught once, you can simply run to the window to escape.

How to Escape the Spotlight Head Without Getting Spotted

There's an achievement/trophy for escaping the Spotlight Head without getting spotted, so it's worth trying to stay undetected. If you get caught, you can quit to the main menu and click continue to try again.

Use the Inhaler to heal if you get caught by the Spotlight Head.

Make your way back to the Vending Machine, insert the Quarter, and press B34 to get your hands on the Welding Glue. Then, use the glue on the Broken Pliers and pick them up.

How to Get the Metal Rose

With the Pliers in your inventory, return to the Golden Rose you saw in the Locker Room. Use the Pliers to remove each finger and pick up the Golden Rose. Now go back to the Rose Door and use it on the hands to open the door. You'll see the notification for unlocking the Thorned Key achievement/trophy pop up on your screen after walking through the door.

Fear the Spotlight offers a classic survival horror experience with plenty of mind-bending puzzles. While the Rose Door puzzle shouldn’t prove too difficult for most players, as the game progresses, you’ll encounter puzzles that may have you scratching your head for hours. That’s part of what makes Fear the Spotlight so fun.

item.title: 7 Reasons Why Cyberpunk 2077 is Replayable
item.description:
Cyberpunk 2077 has had a long road, but CD Projekt RED has pulled off one of the greatest gaming experiences of all time, and that’s something that deserves a second chance and another playthrough to truly experience everything that Cyberpunk 2077 has to offer its fans, whether new or old.

Returning players are in for a great time, and those who have never experienced Cyberpunk 2077 are truly in for a treat. Heading into Night City is an unforgettable experience in terms of combat, consequences, and woven stories, so why not give the game a second chance?

7 Relive Immersive Stories in a City That Never Sleeps

An Abundance of Interesting Characters in Night City and Dogtown

Unforgettable experiences await in Night City, aided by the characters that players will meet. Whether it’s through the main story or the side jobs and gigs, players will come across faces familiar and unfamiliar, each with a story to tell that will remain engrained in players’ minds for how captivating they can be.

There’s a great experience in learning about these characters and their stories, so reliving them is the perfect reason to replay Cyberpunk 2077 . Players can jump back into the familiarity of friends like Jackie Welles, and get creeped out by Peter Pan all over again.

6 Impactful and Experimental Build Variety

Cyberpunk 2.0 Provides Exciting Builds Thanks to Revamped Skills

Embarking on another journey through Night City means that players can try something new, and that’s especially rewarding when it comes to Cyberpunk 2077 ’s 2.0 Updates, which allows players immense versatility with build-crafting thanks to the entirely reworked perk system that will have players experiment with unstoppable potential.

Cyberpunk 2077 fully embraces the RPG mechanics that the game needed, and the reworked perk system allows players plenty of freedom to create their own unique V. For another playthrough, players might want to be a cyber-samurai who only uses katanas or someone who runs around like a tank with a shotgun, or even the new Relic tree for further enhancements to cybernetics.

5 Phantom Liberty, An Original Spy-Thriller

Cyberpunk 2077’s Incredible Expansion Adds New Missions and Dilemmas

On top of a playthrough that will take the average player around 50 hours or even more, players can further extend that time by purchasing the Cyberpunk 2077 expansion, Phantom Liberty . Phantom Liberty is a grand expansion that adds easily another 20 hours to each playthrough, and it’s clear that CD Projekt RED has learned the right lessons as the missions and stories present in Phantom Liberty are unforgettable.

For those who want more from V’s story, or just want a new playground in Dogtown, Phantom Liberty is a must-have, and really has become an essential part of the Cyberpunk 2077 experience. Its story weaves brilliantly with the base game, and there’s no reason not to check out this expansion that involves Idris Elba and a return of Keanu Reeves’ Johnny Silverhand in the midst of a plot to save V and save America.

4 Don’t Forget, The Game is Fixed

The Persistent Issues Found in Year One Are Long Gone

As spoken by Idris Elba as Solomon Reed in Cyberpunk 2077: Phantom Liberty ’s All-In trailer, “ The game is fixed ”. While in reference to the stellar narrative of Phantom Liberty , there’s also a bit of meta-commentary on the state of Cyberpunk 2077 , as the release of Phantom Liberty saw the highly anticipated 2.0 update that provides the game with its definitive and playable state.

Many of the day-one bugs that were persistent for months and years were long gone, and Update 2.0 provides players new and old with a breathtaking experience that deserves to be played. Some day one player might have a bad taste in their mouth for the glitches present, but the current state of Cyberpunk 2077 is entirely playable with hardly any issues found in a standard playthrough.

3 Weapons You Might Have Missed in the First Playthrough

Iconic Weapons Found Through Various Ways, Missable and Powerful

Different choices and methods of exploration may actually lead to some unique weapons with the Iconic rarity. Iconic Weapons in Cyberpunk 2077 often have unique visual traits as well as powerful perks that make them superior to just any gun found on a gang member’s corpse, but some of these weapons are entirely missable, forcing players to miss out on what could be their favorite weapon.

To make the most of a second playthrough, players could ensure that their actions are definitive, and they go out of their way to collect every possible weapon to fulfill V’s stash in their apartment, and try out the different sets of weapons that make the game’s combat so fun.

2 Compelling Consequences From Different Choices

V’s Decisions Directly Influence the Story and Fate of Others

One of the greatest aspects of Cyberpunk 2077 is its narrative consequences and moral dilemmas that make Night City feel like an immersive world of its own. Embarking on Gigs for Fixers usually provides players with moral choices that may not always go the way that they think, or want.

By entering another playthrough, players can see different branching outcomes from the choices they make and the people they meet along the way. Perhaps this new V wants to kill more people than before, or maybe there’s a line of compassion they are unwilling to cross. It really helps to add to an immersive playthrough to think “ What would V / Johnny do? ” rather than “ What would I do? ”

1 A Definitive Ending For Your Specific V

Give V the Canon Ending That Concludes The Story

By replaying Cyberpunk 2077 , players can recontextualize the 7 endings available, and provide their playthrough with a definitive ending that closes the story for V and Johnny Silverhand. Knowing the endings and how they play out helps to create a solidified story where the ending becomes canon for this specific iteration of V, allowing for closure for the player.

In replaying the game, players will not only have the hindsight for the final choice they want to make, but they will also be able to experience the 7 available endings to ensure that they are left satisfied with the conclusion of V’s story, even if it’s not exactly a happy one.

item.title: Most Breathtaking Locations In Grand Theft Auto 5
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Rockstar Games excels in creating timeless and magical open-world experiences like Grand Theft Auto 5.
  • The game features beautifully designed locations that showcase the company's technical prowess.
  • From serene mountain ranges to bustling urban areas, GTA 5 offers diverse and breathtaking landscapes for players to explore.

Rockstar Games has consistently been at the forefront of delivering excellence through its video games. One need only look at the massive success of Grand Theft Auto 5 to understand why this is the case. Initially coming out as a stellar single-player experience that was very much a must-play in every sense, Rockstar ended up going above and beyond the call of duty for this title, integrating a first-person perspective and also adding an online functionality that has taken the world by storm.

A big part of what makes Grand Theft Auto 5 such a timeless and magical experience is the incredible design of its open world, featuring a bunch of unique and interesting locales that will stick with players long after they're finished with this brilliant experience. The fact that these sights have aged so well is a testament to Rockstar's technical prowess, creating state-of-the-art titles that age like a fine wine and never get tiring in the slightest. After all, there's a reason why GTA 5 is still widely talked about to this day, and that's not just because of its multiplayer component.

Updated on October 23, 2024, by Ritwik Mitra: For a game that prides itself on causing as much urban chaos and destruction as possible, it's amazing to see the sheer beauty in the world of Grand Theft Auto 5 when players stop and smell the roses from time to time. The best places in GTA 5 show off the skills that the developers have to offer, making it clear why the massive sandbox of this game is memorable instead of feeling like it's cluttered with empty spaces.

23 Ludendorff

A Small Town Covered In Snow

  • Located in North Yankton

Unlike most of the areas present in Grand Theft Auto 5 , Ludendorff is a location that is only seen in a few set pieces in the game. The first comes in the game's prologue where players take part in a tutorial heist of sorts. The second instance comes when Trevor, incensed by Michael's betrayal, goes to his grave and engages in a war of words before they're ambushed.

In both instances, players can marvel at the beauty of this snowed-in town, but it can be hard to appreciate everything here given how gamers are forced to move at a breakneck pace in both instances where this town is featured. Still, the fact that the alien present in the prologue has become iconic means that some fans have taken the time to explore this small area and uncover what lies beneath the serene beauty of one of GTA 5 's best areas .

22 San Chianski Mountain Range

A Mountain Range That's Largely Isolated From Civilization

  • Found east of San Andreas

The mountain ranges of Grand Theft Auto 5 house a ton of beauty, to the point where thay permit players to enjoy a moment of peace in a game loaded with action-packed moments. This is embodied in the San Chianski Mountain Range, which looks beautiful if players explore it at their own pace instead of blasting through this region in a high-speed car.

With barely any humans to distract the player, they can take their sweet time walking across this area and appreciating the painstaking work that the developers put into one of the best places in GTA 5 . It's a largely underrated location that deserves its plaudits as one of the most serene spots in the game.

21 Mount Haan

Based On The Real-Life Mount Lee

  • Present in Vinewood Hills

For an area that is surrounded by the urban chaos of Grand Theft Auto 5 that fans are familiar with, it's amazing to see how the iconic spots and lush greenery of Mount Haan make it a highlight of the game. Players need only visit this location once to have this area burned into their memory for good.

The luxury cars and posh localities add a ton of flavor to this region, but the obvious highlight here is the Vinewood sign that everyone will be familiar with. It's the biggest reason why many people consider Mount Haan to be one of the best places in GTA 5 .

20 Baytree Canyon

Overlooks The Grand Senora Desert

  • Located in the Great Chaparral area

Most players won't be aware of Baytree Canyon's existence, given that its name isn't shown on the map. However, that doesn't take away from the scenic views that gamers can enjoy in this canyon once they manage to locate it.

The view of the Grand Senora Desert is breathtaking from this area. Players can also see Vinewood Hills from here, letting them enjoy a visual treat during their adventures across the many immersive landscapes of Grand Theft Auto 5 .

19 Heart Attacks Beach

An Oddly Named Beach With A Brilliant View

  • Just beside Mount Gordo

One of the most amusingly named locations in the game, Heart Attacks Beach is one of the many spots that players can find in the world of Grand Theft Auto 5 . The beach is right next to Mount Gordo, which is perhaps why it has been given such a name.

Many people are familiar with Mount Gordo as the location where they can spot a ghost during certain hours of the night. Perhaps some people saw this spirit from the beach and were so scared that their hearts gave out. It's a plausible story for the name, but it is nothing more than speculation.

18 Great Chaparral

A Serene Location Where Less Is More

  • In Los Santos County

Most people would be surprised to see Great Chaparral here, given that the place is mostly empty barring a few farms and trees here and there. However, in a game that is jam-packed with detailed environments and dynamic landscapes, something is interesting about a location that doesn't need all that much to wow players with how peaceful and subtle the views are.

Driving through Great Chaparral during the day is a treat for the eyes if players look around instead of trying to find the quickest way to get from point A to point B. It's a delight for the ages, and fans will have a great time taking their time through this area before moving on to accomplishing the many activities that they can engage with in this amazing title.

17 Tongva Valley

A Beautiful Location With Unique, Varied Landscapes

  • Located just south of Route 68

The region of Tongva boasts some of the best views in Grand Theft Auto 5 , and there's a reason why players who are well-versed when it comes to the game's many regions love this area in particular. Most people talk about Tongva Hills in particular, and that's understandable — that location is undoubtedly the highlight of this area and has many places where players can just stop and look around, getting captivated by the amazing visuals of the game.

However, Tongva Valley shouldn't be underestimated in this regard either. This area has its fair share of amazing locations that will wow players to no end. The sheer amount of detail present here goes a long way in making the location as picturesque as possible. Given how breakneck the pace of this game can be, players will always be welcome to stand and gaze in awe at just how technically impressive this game looks despite being released so long ago.

16 Palomino Highlands

The Coastline Looks Amazing When The Weather Paints It In A Flattering Way

  • Present in Southeast Los Santos County

A beautiful coastline area, Palomino Highlands is a great example of just how diverse the environments of Grand Theft Auto 5 are. Featuring the best of both worlds, players who have seen enough of the copious greenery in this area can walk down the coastline to enjoy the views afforded by the Pacific Ocean.

It's an excellent location to unwind after a long day of butchering innocents and committing grand theft auto on a massive scale. It's a beautiful area, and players will be especially lucky if they capture a great aerial view of this underrated location in the game.

15 Grand Senora Desert

An Arid Expanse With A Lot Of Detail

  • Located in Blaine County

At a glance, a desert doesn't seem like the most interesting area to explore in a video game. However, Rockstar Games has knocked it out of the park while designing this area as well.

The Grand Senora Desert not only looks incredible, but it is also full to the brim with unique secrets. It's a surprisingly scenic area that serves as a breath of fresh air from the usual locales present in the game.

14 Vinewood

Grand Theft Auto 5's Take On Hollywood

  • A famous district in Los Santos

The posh area of Vinewood was bound to make its way onto this list at some point. After all, it's one of the most iconic locations in Grand Theft Auto 5 and possibly the entire Grand Theft Auto series.

Vinewood is a beautiful urban sprawl that is extremely scenic, too. Roaming around this area and finding beautiful spots to take snapshots of is surprisingly easy due to how picturesque the area is. It's a great place to just drive around in and take a break from the chaos.

13 Chiliad Mountain State Wilderness

A State Park Whose Biggest Highlight Is The Eponymous Mountain

  • A state park in Blaine County

Chiliad Mountain is a fun area to explore in Grand Theft Auto 5 . However, the wilderness of this area also has some delightful parts of its own.

The flora and fauna of the Chiliad Mountain State Wilderness make the entire area feel alive — and pretty dangerous, at times. Thankfully, players don't need to worry too much, as long as they spot said danger quickly and don't linger in one spot for too long.

12 Fort Zancudo

An Army Base With Rare Vehicles That Nets A Wanted Level Instantly

  • Outskirts of the Lago Zancudo swamps

Fort Zancudo isn't a breathtaking location in the usual sense. After all, it's just a restricted military area that most people won't even frequent all that much in the game.

However, even taking a look at this place from afar gives a sense of awe. This fort is a rare yet welcome sight — right up until a bunch of missiles come out of nowhere to bomb the player. Then it will time to get out of there fast.

11 Grove Street

A Legendary Street That Fans Of GTA: San Andreas Are Intimately Familiar With

  • Present in Davis, South Los Santos

Grove Street served as the iconic hub of San Andreas and has become one of the most memorable locations in video games. Seeing this area in Grand Theft Auto 5 is a nostalgic sight that many people will love.

For some reason, not many members of the GSF roam around this area that often, since the Ballas seem more prominent. It's saddening, but this is just a small gripe for a location that is legendary and will bring back many fond memories.

10 Tataviam Mountains

A Beautiful Mountain Range

  • East of Los Santos

There is a slew of beautiful locales in Grand Theft Auto 5 , but the Tataviam Mountains stand a cut above the rest because of their beautiful place right between the rural and urban areas of Los Santos.

This area is based on the San Jacinto Mountains of Riverside County and can prove to be quite a scenic and beautiful locale for players wanting to witness the masterful open-world design of this title.

9 Tongva Hills

An Undeveloped Area That Looks All The More Natural And Beautiful As A Result

  • North from Banham Canyon

Many places look beautiful when the sun is setting in the world of Grand Theft Auto 5 , but not many can match the view from Tongva Hills in this regard.

The little streams and waterfalls scattered all across this area are beautiful enough as is, and watching the orange rays of the setting sun bounce off of these reflective surfaces is a treat to witness in every sense of the word.

8 Vespucci Beach

A Beautiful, Well-Maintained Beach

  • Located in Vespucci, Los Santos

There's another place where people can catch the sunset and be more than appeased by the views — Vespucci Beach. This area is Rockstar's take on the famous Venice Beach, and this certainly shows in every aspect of its design.

The area is populated with NPCs going about their day, making this area feel all the more lively and invigorating to explore. It certainly helps that the landscape also features interesting sights, including a massive Ferris Wheel that is surprisingly beautiful to witness.

7 Alamo Sea

A Salt Lake That Is Breathtaking To Behold

  • In the middle of Blaine County, San Andreas

At a glance, it might seem like the seas and oceans of Grand Theft Auto 5 are nothing more than vast expanses of water with nothing to do. However, people who share this notion have clearly never explored the beautiful Alamo Sea.

Driving around the shores of this sea in a boat — or even flying around in a slow plane — is surprisingly calming and makes for a rather underrated highlight in a game that usually sells itself on promoting bombastic action and zany humor over anything else.

6 Paleto Forest

A Coniferous Forest That Looks Amazing In The Right Conditions

  • South of Paleto Bay

Paleto Forest is a vast expanse of wilderness where pollen can also fill up the air at times to make for a genuinely breathtaking sight. It's too bad that this area is said to be populated with bears, making it feel somewhat unsafe for simple sightseers.

Thankfully, there are no physical bears in GTA 5 for players to encounter, so they will be free to soak up the atmosphere of this area without needing to fend off predators. The town near the area itself is also a fantastic place to explore for those who eventually grow weary of the forest.

5 Paleto Bay

A Small Town That Looks Positively Quaint

  • Northwest of Paleto Forest

The small town of Paleto Bay is easily one of the best places to explore in the game, featuring a quaint and calming aesthetic that will keep fans occupied with its innate charm and hypnotizing views. This town is based on the real-life area of Fillmore and is the perfect depiction of small-town America in Grand Theft Auto 5 .

It's easily a much better place to explore for players who wish to avoid attacks from animals, that's for sure. Along with this, people who get bored with the town itself can always choose to roam around the nearby Paleto Cove instead as well.

4 Mount Chiliad

A Legendary Mountain That Needs No Introduction For Long-Time GTA Fans

  • The tallest mountain that's easy to spot in Blaine County

Mount Chiliad is a legendary location in the Grand Theft Auto series, featuring predominantly in San Andreas and rearing its majestic head in Grand Theft Auto 5 as well.

While this place might be infamous for featuring one of the most obtuse Easter eggs around, one can't deny that the place itself looks majestic, and it's a complete treat to explore at times as well.

item.title: Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom Players Aren't Happy About Missing Outfit Variant
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Fans are disappointed by the lack of a hoodless Zelda outfit option in Echoes of Wisdom.
  • Despite being featured in key art promoting Echoes of Wisdom, players can only briefly wear the Disguise outfit with the hood down.
  • The Bread Pirate and other fans are pushing for a hoodless outfit variant to be added to the game.

While The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom has been well-received, some fans are disappointed by the lack of the option to use the hoodless outfit variant for Zelda. This complaint is a small one in the grand scheme of things, but players are questioning why developer Grezzo chose not to make it available for more of Echoes of Wisdom ’s playtime.

Among the features included in Echoes of Wisdom is the option to change Zelda’s appearance. Throughout the game, players can unlock various outfits for the character, including some unique ones like Cat Clothes. In addition to changing the character's look, a few of these outfits even grant bonus effects. Recently, one player pointed out a missed opportunity for the developer to give players another outfit variant to use during the game.

As highlighted in a recent video, a YouTuber known as The Bread Pirate revealed a strange limitation they noticed regarding the outfits in Echoes of Wisdom . Specifically, players can only wear the Disguise outfit with the hood not covering Zelda for a couple of minutes of the game. The gamer pointed out how the lack of a hoodless option for the outfit was even stranger considering the marketing for the game; the box art of Echoes of Wisdom shows the character with her hood down. Understandably, this official artwork could lead some to think the look was an option available throughout most of the game.

Fans Want Zelda's Hoodless Outfit Variant Playable Throughout Echoes of Wisdom

As it turns out, many fans on the internet agreed with The Bread Pirate regarding the lack of a hoodless outfit variant for Zelda. While players are disappointed about this missing outfit option in Echoes of Wisdom , The Bread Pirate and others are attempting to do something about it. Using the #HoodlessZelda hashtag, The Legend of Zelda community wants to get the developer's attention to see if the outfit variant could be added to the game in the coming months.

While it would be nice to see this variant become available for more of Echoes of Wisdom , only time will tell if it is ever added by the developer. Regardless, many fans have enjoyed the latest top-down perspective Zelda game from Grezzo and Nintendo despite some frame rate issues. Following its release, Echoes of Wisdom has enjoyed impressive sales success, with better initial sales than the Link’s Awakening remake in Japan. As Nintendo fans wait for the eventual official reveal of the Switch’s successor console, it will be interesting to see if Echoes of Wisdom can keep its sales momentum on the current-generation hardware.
